turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kooroona, South Australia.
turn.1: Where is Kooroona located in relation to South Australia?
turn.2: Kooroona, South Australia Kooroona is a rural locality at the north end of the Yorke Peninsula of South Australia, situated directly south of the town of Moonta.
turn.3: What part of the Yorke Peninsula is it on?
turn.4: It is located in the Copper Coast Council.
turn.5: When was it given its name?
turn.6: The name and boundaries of Kooroona were formalised on January 1999, in respect of the long established local name.
turn.7: What was it known as before that?
turn.8: The area was alternatively known as Copper Valley, and had previously been known as South Bower, after a mining venture in the area.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The historic Moonta Cemetery is located at the northern tip of Kooroona and is listed on the South Australian Heritage Register.
turn.11: Is there anything else of importance there?
turn.12: The remainder of the locality is largely agricultural land.
